title: Rude receptionist
body: My partner rang on Friday (3/9/12) for a phone consultation and was asked what the problem was,he told her and she abruptly said "ring back Monday no more appointments" now this ended up with my partner being in A&E. not the first time I have encountered rude receptionists at this surgery,some of the most unhelpful and unprofessional people I've met.

title: Appalling booking service
body: My stepdaughter is registered at this surgery. We have now tried twice to book an appointment, the first time we walked into the centre to make the booking over the the counter. We were told quite bluntly  that we had to do an e consult booking. When we tried to explain that there was more than one problem to deal with and as we were standing there it seemed the logical thing to do. We were told that was the only way to make an appointment, so we sat in the reception and tried to book. The system is very confusing to navigate and yes we are tech savvy, so after a stand off with receptionist managed to make an appointment. Five months down the line we have tried in vain to make an appointment, only to be faced with same problem. You cannot ring the centre as nobody answers the phone. We have now given up and registered with another GP, with a voice at the end of the phone and whereby you can make the appointment over the phone.

title: Poor communication, false promises again!!!
body:
The issues over the years with the surgery,  I have never made an official complaint however as they have a consistent habit of not returning calls  amongst other things, promising the patient when you want to speak to someone they will call back and don’t. 
A lot of lip service but not sincere I have since found out.. When they are dealing with something in regards to a patient they should see it through to the end and until it’s resolved. Stop shying and hiding away. Deal with the problems and be accountable. When you tell a patient you will call them back, call them back!!!!! Unfortunately one thing is said but they mean something else or do not mean it at all.

title: Rude member of Staff
body: My Husband was told by the nurse to make an appointment for a further review of his medication. This rude member of staff spoke down to him and slammed the door in his face as she did not want to deal with the query as reception was not open. Funny how there are signs everywhere saying they don't tolerate abuse but they are allowed to give it out. Since Management has changed this practice has gone way down hill. If we could find another Doctors to go to we would as the service given by reception staff is appalling!

title: Very thorough review
body: Difficult to phone for appointment but responded to email quickly. For a review happy with two week wait for appointment. Delighted with actual appointment Doctor very good and covered everything I wanted reviewed and is for arranging for Hospital follow up

author: Dragonfly42
title: Communication has been excellent
body: I have a prostrate problem which is being continually monitored by Urology staff. The communication and feedback I receive has been excellent it is clear and detailed

readBy.name: Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust

author: lupusrh69
title: A Long Stay
body:
I drove into the hospital about a month ago after a prolonged episode of bradycardia. When I arrived in the emergency department I was triaged quite quickly and I had a bed in a side cubicle which made the wait for a bed on the ward much more bearable. The food here is great. The doctors and nurses are brilliant.  
I've only had a couple issues, I was supposed to be getting an ambulance to Belfast today in order to have a heart ablation but the ambulance didn't show up, this was the second time I was left waiting for the ambulance which means that I am going to be in hospital for another week. I also was quite concerned when a technician performed a 12 lead ECG on me without checking that they had the right patient - I wasn't supposed to getting the ECG. This concerned me as what if I was a vulnerable patient and instead of it being an ECG, it was medications? I spoke to the medical student assistant who informed the nurse in charge and they have said that they will look into this matter and ensure it hasn't happened again  
Despite this I can't fault the care I have been receiving over the past month. I am very grateful for all of their help

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Thank you so much
body: I moved to this practice 18 months ago in the middle of the first lockdown when everything was more difficult for everyone, but was so grateful to discover that this practice was a million time better than my old practice had been in normal times. The 2 doctors I have had dealings with have been knowledgeable, efficient and have genuinely gone above and beyond to get me the the help I needed; I have been rung back quickly for phone consultations, had referral letters dispatched quickly, seen a doctor in person, had good advice and recommendations and generally been treated as though I mattered. Considering all the pressure you have been under for the last 18 months, you have been amazing and I am full of admiration for you and very grateful for your help.

author: TPPcglbrum
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: He actually really does care
body:
I’ve been getting support from Nigel for about five years now. It actually might be longer than that, but I’m not great with dates and remembering things.  
  
When I first met Nigel, I was using heroin and crack and anything else I could get my hands on. But today I’m totally drug free, and I’ve not used anything for about 3 years.  
  
I’ve faced a lot of challenges in my life, including mental health issues like hearing voices, which I do get some support and medication for. But for me, even though I’ve got a GP and a mental health worker, it’s been Nigel who has made all the difference. It’s felt like he’s always been there when I’ve needed his support. Whether I’ve just needed an appointment for a drug test or to confide in him when I’ve been feeling down. Or needed help to stop craving drugs when an old mate has offered them to me. He’s been there ready to listen, support and encourage me.  
  
  
I feel like people like Nigel are rare. When I speak to him I can tell that he actually really does care. In my eyes he’s gone above and beyond, and I want people to know that he is the one who has helped me to get strong enough to not just stop using drugs but also stay off them.  
  
I genuinely feel like he’s helped to save my life. Thank you, Nigel, you have been golden.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)

author: pisceskf78
title: How am I to make contact?
body:
I've been trying to get through to the physiotherapy department in Kirkby-in-Ashfield for ten days now. They sent a letter which I received on the 3rd, asking me to call back and schedule an appointment.  
The letter says to ring between 8:15 and 4, and says an answerphone service is available outside these working hours and during busy periods. I have been trying constantly, at regular intervals for the whole time - there is no answer to my calls, and no facility for me to leave any sort of message. So how am I to make contact?  
The letter says that they will discharge me if I don't contact them within 14 days - well thats actually 11 days from when I actually got the letter. I've spent 10 days now trying to get through, so what's going to happen now? Are they going to discharge me?

author: Bethm43
title: I didn't feel ready to leave because I was still very shaky
body:
Birmingham City hospital I came to see my partner for the day in Birmingham. I was in the toilet in Birmingham new Street, slipped in the toilet onto my knees and twisted my legs and hurt my hip.  
I had no feeling in my legs so an ambulance was called, nurses was great on arrival has I’ve got a disability cerebral palsy which means I am unable to immobilise properly. The nurses was very friendly on arrival . And all observations was done, had an High temperature ,Bloods were taken, waited three hours for the doctors did my examinations.  
I was very much in pain and consistently through my body I feel that the consultant didn’t do thorough examination of my body, they just sort did a quick examination of legs not back. No x-rays was given and was sent out at 4 am being disabled with no accommodation because I am from Wales and my partners parents house isn't really accessible for me.  
I am very upset about the experience. I should ever had x-rays. I was also in pain and told them that I would struggle to immobilise for the rest of that night but they didn't seem to be bothered about that, they just said if it happens again to call Us. I didn't feel ready to leave hospital because I was still very Shaky on my feet  
I would not recommend this hospital to anyone!!

readBy.name: Sandwell and West Birmingham Hospitals NHS Trust

author: chamaeleonws44
title: Tonsillectomy at New Cross Wolverhampton
body: I attended New Cross hospital in Wolverhampton yesterday for a tonsillectomy and stayed in recovery on Appleby Suite. I wanted to share how FANTASTIC the staff were. I felt very well cared for and the surgeon came to see me before and after my operation, prescribing plenty of painkillers and antibiotics as well as a throat deflam spray. The anaesthetist were brilliant and really put me at ease and showed care and interest as well as kept me well informed about what was happening. The nurses were great too. X I wanted to share what an amazing job they are doing and to say a massive thank you to them.

title: Run its awful
body:
Go on google reviews and read what everyones writing. From disabled people, new mums, elderly patients no one can get through to them. This was even before Covid they have latched onto that excuse now (even though the country is opening up to operate BAU).
I can call at 08:00am to have the phone put down without entering a queue. 
I eventually went to 111 who got me an appointment with them.
Later calling this GP in the afternoon for an update the call rings from caller 4 to 1 and then continues to ring until you hang up. The receptionists cant even be bothered to pick up.
There is 1 month onwards wait for appointments online.
Your basically left with no GP. Thats the raw situation and they do nothing to fix it. Worse they want new patients? One person reviewed that they ended up in ICU without these charlatans helping them.
The shame is that the Drs and Nurses are great when once in a kajillion years you get an appointment. 
I have submitted a NHS comissioner complaint and urge everyone to do the same.
Abysmal.

author: Irvin540
title: Treatment from a nurse
body: Last week I tried to take my own life and someone called the paramedics who were amazing with me a would like to thank them but when we got to the hospital the nurse was horrible their attitude was bad I then asked to use the toilet when I was in the side room so the nurse said no a gave me a bed pan I asked for privacy they refused and expected me to stand at the bit where all the nurses were and do the toilet I have never been so belittled in my life and these are the people thats meant to help you.

title: Great practice
body: Quick response from doctors. Can get face to face appointments when needed. Love the econsult option. Some lovely doctors and reception staff.

author: empathywg38
title: Great care
body: I came into hospital and had a pace maker fitted and the staff and care I received was second to none. Since then I have had a fall and suffered a broken ankle, again I am being very well looked after by all the brilliant staff including the nurses and student nurses. They come to see if I am ok as I am in a cast they are helping me to get to the bathroom and even go a sfar as washing me and giving me a shave. I would just like to say thank you so much for the brilliant care.

readBy.name: Western Health and Social Care Trust

author: Moaning Mini
title: Parking
body:
Attended QMH for a 8.35am clinic appointment and was shocked that parking was an issue at that time in the morning, all spaces allocated to patient and visitors were full! Are there really that amount of patients attending at that time?  
Fortunately I am fairly ambulant and was able to park in car park 4 which is some distance to main reception to check in. When will staff parking ever be addressed to allow a stress free visit to hospital for patients?

author: Hapgg95
title: Aunt admitted to Slieve Roe House in Kilkeel Co.Down
body:
My Aunt is 92 years of age. She was admitted to Slieve Roe House as her care package at home became inadequate for her needs and she initially was admitted for respite to give social services time to source enhanced care. After 4 weeks it became apparent that this extra cover was proving difficult to find. In the meantime my aunt settled into Slieve Roe very well and decided at this stage that she would like to stay. She realised that she needed extra care and also that living on her own with failing health was causing her some anxiety. The layout and the gardens at Slieve Roe were a bonus for her as she loves nature and enjoys sitting outside.  
The Slieve Roe staff were very accommodating and helpful and having company was a big bonus for her mental health. My aunt is very impressed with the food provided, the variety and the presentation. She is very happy and I cannot praise the staff in Slieve Roe enough for their help, compassion and practical help towards my aunt during this transition. I am hoping that my aunt will be able to continue to enjoy her later years in the relaxed yet very efficient atmosphere of Slieve Roe.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Amazing hospital Amazing staff
body:
Dear amazing NHS staff

Words cannot express how much I am truly thankful and grateful for all your incredible support during my recent stay in hospital on the 21st of August to the 23rd of August with A and E and Guildford ward.

Everyone I encountered was so incredibly professional, supportive, caring, friendly  and helpful and myself and my family will be forever grateful for your wonderful support.

readBy.name: Royal Surrey County Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

author: DeeChat
title: Hysteroscopy
body: I was extremely nervous about having a procedure I knew very little about. I was the first patient of the day for them and it was quite early! , but I cannot thank the  nurses and healthcare assistant who were with me throughout the procedure enough. They chatted away with me during the hysteroscopy and the healthcare assistant held my hand throughout, remaining cheerful, even when I squeezed her hand too much. It was fleetingly painful on the odd occasion, but their focus on my comfort, their jokes and their consideration for me was exemplary and made the whole thing much more bearable. They made me feel cared for and put me at my ease. Theirs is not an easy job and I want them to know that they made a very nervous and emotional patient feel much better...and less alone.. Thank you so much.

author: novemberkd77
authorRole: a staff member posting for a carer/relative
title: First class Paediatric Ward experience
body:
My daughter has complex needs and is a regular at Daisy Hill Hospital. Sometimes I come in via A&E and others I am brought straight up to the ward. We are usually brought in via Ambulance - the multiple crews involved are all amazing - extremely helpful. I feel like we know all the crews in the area now and all I can say is they are all absolutely brilliant.  
The Emergency Department has been great some times, more so recently. This is because on a couple of occasions I felt that it was difficult to get my point across, with some staff seeming less experienced with complex needs. However, ever since the consultant intervened the Emergency Department experience has been much better - great and very positive.  
Moving up onto the paediatric ward - we really love it up here. We really prefer the ward here at Daisy Hill Hospital over the Royal. If we can we choose here because of the first class equipment, staff, assistants, cleaners etc. It really makes the stay easier with such excellent staff, as they really do look after the parent as well which is very important.Every single nurse has been amazing - they really do everything they can for us - they are simply fantastic. The paediatric ward is absolutely great.  
The only two improvements I could think of would be if more specialists were available. I would also like there to be a vending machine with water in it in the Emergency Department - as there is often a long wait in the ED with there often being no chance of getting anything to eat or drink. This small change would make a big difference.  
Overall, the paediatric ward, and the hospital in general, has been excellent and the staff involved in my daughter's care have been absolutely fantastic!

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust
Ulster University, Faculty of Life and Health Sciences

author: velamg99
title: Came for a full check up
body: The nurse was so friendly, professional and made me feel at ease.

author: cheetahze43
title: Care in Ambulance, A&E and Ward 33 VHK, Fife.
body:
I fell on Friday night 10/9/21 dislocating my ankle and fracturing my leg. After initially waiting 3hours for ambulance support I received excellent care from Sheona and Nikki who escorted me to hospital.  
Thank you so much to you both, you were amazing. On arriving at hospital I received further excellent care from the A&E Dr Debbie who explained everything really clearly offering reassurance the whole way. She was supported by Jenna and Micha the staff nurses who were both fantastic. From here everyone has been brilliant, radiographers, porters, physio’s, Dr’s, The Theatre team, and every single member of staff on ward 33, you were all so lovely, nothing was to much trouble, you showed kindness and compassion throughout despite knowing how busy I know you all are. Special thanks also to Taylor the student nurse on ward 33, you were fab.  
My care has been excellent, the only disappointing area of my experience was the wait for the ambulance, I say this not as a complaint but in support of the ambulance service for more resource. I was on a street for 3 hours in extreme pain, I know nobody wants that, it was traumatic and I urge anyone who doesn’t truly need an ambulance please do not call one to allow them to get to those most in need.  
Thank you all for your care, you were all fantastic. Xxx

readBy.name: Office of Murdo Fraser, MSP for Mid Scotland & Fife

author: Cassandra2021
title: Childbirth
body: I attended Inverurie Maternity Hospital for the birth of my baby boy and I can't vouch for the staff enough! I was quite nervous about the whole ordeal and I wasn't entirely sure what was normal during the process. I had done my research or course but it hadn't quite prepared me. Perhaps it's something you have to experience firsthand to truly understand. The support and reassurance from the staff on duty enabled me to have a positive first experience and a relatively stress-free one. There was a moment when protocol didn't allow me pain relief and rather than do nothing, they offered me a tense machine and encouraged me to stay active to reduce the pain. It was very person-centred. I didn't feel like a 'numbered patient' but one that actually mattered to someone. They read through my birth plan and conducted themselves in a manner that respected my wishes. They were also very well educated in their profession which was very reassuring and aided my experience in a positive way.

readBy.name: Office of Alexander Burnett, MSP for Aberdeenshire West

author: lupusdp59
title: Condition Management Programme
body: I have having a lot of shoulder pain and some mental health issues as a result of my mum passing. I self referred to the Condition Management Programme and was set up for physio remotely with Seána. Seána not only helped me with exercises for my pain, she also offered lots of reassurance around my mental health.

readBy.name: Belfast Health and Social Care Trust
South Eastern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Rc.x3
title: Cauda Equina Syndrome
body:
Following a terrible time suffering with severe back and leg pain not taking seriously by my own GP and health board, I finally received a delayed diagnosis of cauda equina syndrome and was promptly transferred to the QUEH ward 64.  
I cannot praise every single member of staff I encountered more. During a very difficult and vulnerable time for me every single person I encountered was kind, compassionate and helpful, especially considering my bad experiences leading up to my admission to ward 64. Nursing staff were very kind and welcoming, the surgical team (lead by Mr Barrett in my case) were all excellent, as were every AHP and domestic & service staff I encountered. As a nurse myself I feel it’s so important to highlight the good, especially in these times. I cannot fault anyone I encountered in my hospital admission and I am so grateful for all their help and support with my admission and all the care they took in arranging my discharge support.

author: startr96
authorRole: a staff member posting for a carer/relative
title: Fantastic Staff
body:
My son was brought into Daisy Hill Hospital Emergency Department with stomach tenderness. My time in the Emergency Department was really very good. The staff were all fantastic - I really could not complain about it.  
We were then brought straight up onto the Daisy Paediatric Ward. The ward has been really excellent - again no complaints. All the staff are really lovely - both day and night staff. Really exceptional. I cannot think of anything to improve - keep doing what you're doing!

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: raincz69
authorRole: a staff member posting for a carer/relative
title: Lovely, helpful & nice staff
body:
We arrived in A&E when my child started experiencing breathing difficulties. The Emergency Department was quite good - we were brought through quickly where nebulizers and steroids were quickly given.  
The paediatric ward itself has been absolutely fine. The staff up here are all absolutely lovely - extremely helpful and very nice. I cannot suggest anything to improve - the paediatric department here at Daisy Hill is just excellent.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: skyrb96
authorRole: a staff member posting for a carer/relative
title: Epilepsy Clinic
body: I come with my daughter to the Epilepsy Clinic at Daisy Hill Hospital around twice a year. Our experience here has been a good one. The clinic is very good, with all the doctors being extremely helpful. They have really been very good in helping us learn as we go along. All the nurses are excellent as well - really very good. I cannot think of a single thing which could be improved upon - the clinic has been exactly what we expected and needed it to be!

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust
Ulster University, Faculty of Life and Health Sciences

author: 10Sept
title: First hospital overnight stay
body: I was admitted to the Borders General Hospital on recently and discharged a few days later. I wasn't expecting to be staying overnight however my experience was indeed a good one and I am now on my way to full recovery. I was on ward 7 in room 2 for my treatment. I would like to thank all the day and night staff who helped my stay feel comfortable through my treatment. However I would like to thank Angie and Brian in particular as I was impressed with not only their help but their happy and polite attitude towards every patient despite trying to juggle a million and one things at once. Brian's humour certainly lifted staff and patients spirits. I would appreciate if this feedback reached them. Thank you very much to your team.

readBy.name: Office of Colin Smyth, MSP for South Scotland
Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)

author: P Mac
title: Belfast City Hospital Radiography Team Cancer Unit
body: The team were brilliant today.   Explained everything about the process (CT Scan) and comforted me throughout.

readBy.name: Belfast Health and Social Care Trust

title: Permanent Struggle
body:
There appears to be permanent problems at this practice with the ability to make appointments to see doctors.  If you haven't been on the phone for a good 30 minutes at 8am then honestly don't bother.

Re-prescription of medication is equally frustrating with texts received stating your request made 24 hours ago can only be attended to with an appointment with a doctor, whom you can only make an appointment with the next morning.  

This isn't Corona virus related.  This surgery has always been like this since I've been with them which spans a period before the pandemic.

author: cointf98
title: My Cancer treatment
body: Hello am under the care of Dr Thomas, Dept Maxillofacial Surgery, back in April this year I found a lump in my neck so I was refered to Dr Thomas at the Royal stoke Hospital, I sore Dr Thomas and he examed my neck, he did not like the feal of the lump, so I had a byopsey done and it turned out to be cancer, he also had byopseyes of the back of my tongue and under my tongue, and my tonsills removed to see where the source of the cancer was coming from, but he found out it was in my lymph glands so I had 66 of them removed, ime on the mend now thanks to mr Thomas and his team, they saved my life and cannot thank them enough, so thank you Mr Thomas, all the nurses and staff, I was very well looked after, so thank you all from the bottom of my heart, thank you one top surgen, thank you again 100 stars

title: Rubbish service
body: It was my first month of ordering. Couldnt get through on phone. After 20mins told 50th in Q. . Same thing on different days. Had a problem with my pouches and wished to change make of pouch to another brand. Told they would send me out an emergency supply. Got my emergency supply 6 days later. Not what I call quick. No dry wipes or bags were included even though this was my monthly order. Very bad service for a new customer. I have changed to another supplyer who I can speak with on phone and have been great. Would Not recommend fittleworth.

author: Chlst75
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: GI wards full
body:
I am currently her at AMU because all the GI wards are full, so I’ve been allocated a bed here while and the GI doctors can come down and assess me here, so at least I’m getting seen to. I’ve just been having lots of tests recently and scans, it’s been a week on but unfortunately I’ve no diagnosis yet which is a little frustrating. It’s just more the fact if I knew what was wrong then I would be able to start the coping process. I do worry and I’m cautious whatever I have needs treatment which I can’t get yet until we know the cause.  
The staff are however lovely here and it’s a nice wee place. Only thing is I am sick of the same menu and it always being something with chicken or curry I have had them all and just actually want some plain food now. For lunch today I just took some chicken soup and potatoes and it was actually quite nice. The cleaning is very good here. They are so helpful and can’t do enough for you here. It is a busy ward but a good one all the same. Yes I do feel safe in terms of COVID well at least I hope so. I’ve been swabbed twice since being here and I know they swab everyone who comes through A&E so that settles me. I also have both my vaccines which gives me some comfort.  
It is always clear to me what the tests are they medical team are doing, I’m a nurse myself so If they’re doing a blood test I make sure to ask them what for and why. I do worry so I ask questions and they always explain well what they’re doing or looking for. Overall getting on good here and think the staff are perfect stars.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: uniformne59
authorRole: a staff member posting for a carer/relative
title: Paediatric Ward has been absolutely fabulous
body:
We were sent to A&E by the GP when my son wasn't eating or drinking. The Emergency Department was great and every staff member was extremely helpful and really nice.  
Up on the Daisy Paediatric Ward it has been absolutely fabulous. All the staff up here are really really really lovely. Literally everyone has been absolutely brilliant - I could not fault a single one.  
Everything about our stay has been great and nothing could have been made better for us. Everyone is just so attentive and all are doing such an amazing job!

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: J.Abbotsford.
title: A colonoscopy
body: I was treated in Victoria Hospital Kirkcaldy in Fife. From arriving in the unit every person I met actually looked at me with welcoming smiles and clearly stating who they were and where we were going. In the endoscopic area I was given a gown and modesty shorts to wear ( which made me giggle looking at my reflection) then sat in a nice area to wait. I was then taken to have a cannula inserted and some questions regarding my health. The doctor Mr. Wilson then came an explained what the risks were involved and I signed my consent form. I was then taken to the scope room and introduced to the 3 nurses that would look after me during the procedure. It was friendly and reassuring. I had sedation and before I knew it I was being taken to the ward to recover with a super cup of tea and toast. Dr. Wilson then explained about how I would go forward and wait 3-5 weeks for my biopsy results to come back. I have had this procedure before and it can’t compare in any way how much easier it was for me this time. From Nicola taking an IRN blood test before to Vivienne who done my b. p checks etc. Truly well looked after all through the morning.

author: Leeblades
title: Felt better after my appointment
body: I felt better after my appointments the people that worked there was lovely and understanding and it made a difference

readBy.name: Sheffield Health and Social Care NHS Foundation Trust
St. Andrews University ScotGEM Medical Students

author: Keeen88
title: My experience A&E of CAH
body: I came in to the hospital recently via A&E which was very busy, I was waiting for an extremely long time in a lot of pain. Although I received pain relief my wait was still very uncomfortable and I wasn't updated as to how long I was going to be waiting for. When I eventually was seen the staff couldn't do enough for me and the ensured all my needs were met as best they could do. This emergency department is so understaffed and needs huge changes made as the long wait most definitely compromises patient care. Although medical and nursing teams are extremely competent and I cannot fault their care in the slightest.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: whiskeypn64
title: Grampian Sexual Health Clinic - Exceptional service with every visit
body:
I have used the services provided by Grampian Sexual Health Clinic for several years now. They have always been exceptional. However, I have recently realised that the quality of their services cannot be compared to other places. That said, I left Aberdeen over two years ago, yet I continue to return to this specific clinic because of the staff, help, and the overall quality of care and treatment delivered. Whilst every visit to this clinic has been phenomenal, my last visit this September exceeded all my expectations and previous visits.  
It all began by arranging my appointment. I spoke to an incredibly lovely lady who even remembered me! I wouldn’t expect it but it felt absolutely incredible as it provided me with confidence and faith that I was yet again right to return to this clinic. I was offered appointments that would best suit me and my busy schedule and all was arranged within minutes.  
On the day of my visit, I was very politely welcomed and very well informed about the whole process. I showed up 20 minutes before my appointment and only waited 5 minutes before the nurse came and was already ready for me. The nurse - Rachel - was wonderful. I honestly loved her so much - she is the reason why this visit went above and beyond my expectations. There are two reasons for this. One, I have a friend who was stressed as he recently tested positive for an STI and didn’t receive the support he had hoped for where he lives. Rachel, without being even asked, offered to speak to my friend over the phone. Whilst the appointment was for me only, she didn’t mind and actually put his mind at ease. She provided him with all necessary details, and even provided the necessary emotional support! My friend couldn’t stop thanking me for doing this for him. Meanwhile, it wasn’t me - it was all Rachel. Later, I had a great chat with her and we did the full screen as always. She was very gentle, caring, and understanding as I am not the biggest fan of needles. Before I left, she even gave me a leaflet for my friend to read through and sent me a text message with a link about STIs which I was able to direct to my friend. Incredibly helpful! She highly deserves to be recognised for her work and care for patients. I hope this review will reach her! She is a prime example of an exceptional nurse.  
Thank you for your services, I know I will continue to return. However, my biggest thanks go to Rachel for being incredible towards not only me and my friend over the phone, but also for being an incredible nurse.

readBy.name: Aberdeen City Health & Social Care Partnership
Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2022)

author: coordinationff83
authorRole: a staff member posting for a carer/relative
title: Paediatric Ward has been brilliant
body:
We came to Daisy Hill Hospital due to my child suffering from bronchiolitis. We started in the Emergency Department - the experience here was grand. The only thing I would suggest is that there was someone there being detained by the police. I feel there should be a separate area for this as there were children around & it made me feel uncomfortable. However, I was soon moved elsewhere which I was happy about. Other than this my Emergency Department experience was good.  
After being seen in the Emergency Department, I was quickly admitted in a very smooth process. The staff were all brilliant and kept me calm.  
The paediatric ward has been brilliant. I cannot fault a single thing. Every single member of staff has been brilliant. Even though they are so busy they still have time for you. I would particularly like to mention two members of staff - the sister Ciara and Sinead who was on at night - both of who have been absolutely brilliant.  
I don't really have any other improvements to suggest, except maybe apart from letting both partners in instead of just the one (due to COVID regulations) - rather than having to swap out.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Relieved Mum!
title: Helped my son immensely
body:
My son was really ill. He had a psychotic break and spent weeks in PICU and in Lime Ward in Omagh, in the Tyrone and Fermanagh Hospital. He was put onto high doses of anti-psychotic medication and allowed home where he fell under the care of the community team at SWAH. From his first appointment, he was introduced to Eye Movement Desensitization and Reprocessing (EMDR) and started improving. He found it really beneficial - as did our whole family. It reduced anxiety and helped him gain control and perspective when his thoughts began running away with him. His nurse was excellent and we really couldn't have asked for a more professional and more compassionate health care professional. Immediately I felt my son was listened to and I felt that his health care professional was concerned wtih what my son was concerned about i.e. anxiety and reducing medication. EMDR was a really useful tool and it meant a focus on the future and well-being as opposed to raking over the past. In my son's case this was really helpful.  
He is now completely off medication, going from 4mg of risperadone in April / May. He reduced slowly with the help of EMDR and is now drug free. He has returned to College in England and is feeling great.  
I think that EMDR was really beneficial in his case and I am so happy with the care he got. We never expected him to recover so quickly. It is unbelievable how well he is considering how ill he was just a few short months ago. He is confident going forward, using EMDR whenever he starts to feel anxiety.

readBy.name: Western Health and Social Care Trust

author: septemberec43
title: Outstanding care in the emergency department
body: I had an unfortunate bike accident resulting in a dislocated shoulder. The care I received throughout was exceptional. The ambulance crew was very professional and made sure I get adequate pain relief and travel well. In the emergency department I was cared for very well, my shoulder was replaced. Everything was explained, what will happen, what can I expect. The staff went out of their way to help me in this unfortunate situation, they made sure I was safe and help is in place for me at home.

readBy.name: Office of Colin Smyth, MSP for South Scotland

author: earthgb69
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Fantastic Midwives
body:
My time on Maternity has been really good. All the midwives here at Daisy Hill have been fantastic - really helpful.  
I had an elective section - this was fine and went well. This is my second C-Section so I knew what to expect and it was pretty straightforward. The staff were all fantastic and helpful - I couldn't say enough about them.  
I would especially like to mention Erica, one of the student midwives who was on all night - she was absolutely brilliant.  
I cannot think of anything to improve. Thank you to everyone involved in my care.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: scorpiusxg37
title: Heart monitoring
body: Saw a lovely nurse who explained everything about the monitor and how to use it, she made me feel at ease and comfortable.

author: yellowdn97
title: Lovely Ward
body:
My child had a virus and needed a drip for it. We were admitted following results coming back. The Daisy Paediatric Ward has been really good. We have been in now a couple of times and it has always been really nice. The staff have all been lovely. The nurse on the ward when we were initially admitted was brilliant - she really calmed me down and was really lovely.  
I cannot think of anything on the ward which could be improved. The ward and staff are both simply lovely.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: giraffekn66
title: CGL was a great help
body: Well my story started 16 years ago when first started smoking crack cocaine and then moved onto heroin 2 years later and since then I've been in and out of drug services, but with CGL is the first time Ive felt that I actually had a drug worker that cared and wanted to help me. In December 2020 2 days before xmas social services took my 4 day old baby girl and put her in foster care due to my drug issues instead of me thinking its the end of the world and getting deeper into the drugs my drug worker card helped me in my recovery she made me understand you can't do it alone, and to join in on courses they provide and groups via zoom and also fircroft college. It was the best decision Ive ever made as now 5 months on Im still abstinent from drugs and on the verge of getting my baby girl back. Thankyou CGL.

author: Eliz A
title: My mum's care
body: My mum tripped and was admitted to ward 10b under Mr Martin and the ortho team. They looked after her amazingly well. The physio, OT, nurses and doctors all worked together to make sure she recovered and discharged home safely after her shoulder replacement. Excellent care, thank you.

author: Pollyb59
title: Painkillers didn't work
body:
Traumatised. Sedation and pain killers didn’t work. Continual pain during my colonoscopy. Asked the doctor to stop, they didn’t. Excruciating pain brought me to tears. Been in my bed since coming home from hospital on Friday. Still in pain. Couldn’t walk on Saturday, stomach pain, fever, felt sick. Can’t eat or sleep. Called my own dr this morning Monday, need to speak to them.  
Still need to get 2 polyps removed but it won’t be at this hospital. I will need general anaesthetic to get this done.  
The doctor never even spoke to me after the op.  
This was the worst experience of my life.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)
Office of Colin Smyth, MSP for South Scotland

author: Buttercup21
title: Daughter born at 32 weeks 3 days
body:
I had been having problems with my bp from my booking appointment. I knew then it was a girl as my oldest I had bp issues in the last month and with my son I had no bp issues.  
I spent 2 days in Dorchester after my routine growth scan in August 2021. We were due October. I was given 2 steroid injections to help baby lungs if we didn’t make it to 34-37 weeks as they planned. I then spent 2 weeks in Southampton hospital with high bp and preeclampsia.  
The day before birth there was talk of having baby as my kidney levels weren’t what they should be and were getting worse. They’d done a last lot of bloods and kidneys were now stable so didn’t need to have baby. 11pm that night bp high again and medication wasn’t controlling it. The decision was made that rather then keep going round in circles we would have baby now. By this time it’s 1am and I’m waking up my husband that he has to come back as we are having baby. We live 1.5 hours away. He got there just in time.  
They took photos of her for us before taking her to nicu. My husband got to go see her first and then I got wheeled down. She was in nursery 4 first in an incubator and put on oxygen but within 24 hours she no longer needed assistance with this. She also had a feeding tube. She then got moved to nursery 1 as it was just her feeding we needed to work on.  
Unfortunately she couldn’t tolerate anything. Formula or my milk. She was nil by mouth, had an X-ray but they couldn’t find a reason for it. She then had to have a long line put in to get things into her. She had to go on the sun bed twice for jaundice. She got moved to nursery 2 because of this but soon got moved back to nursery 1.  
Southampton then decided she didn’t need to be with them anymore but she couldn’t go to our local hospital as they don’t accept babies with long lines. At day 17 she was transferred here to Musgrove Park. She had her longline in and was having feeds through her tube 13ml every 2 hours. In her week here her milk has increased to 40ml every 3 hours. Her longline was removed as well as her feeding tube. She was taken out the incubator and put in cot. She has come on leaps and bounds.  
The staff are amazing and put you at ease asking anything. They will explain anything you don’t know. Phoning up whenever I needed to make sure she was ok. Nothing was too much bother. Even though not a first time mum they still told me things I hadn’t realised and didn’t make me feel daft. Our week here has been amazing watching her progress with feeds and weight gain.  
Having 2 older ones at home it has been really difficult being away. If I was with baby I felt guilty not being with them and when I was with them I felt guilty not being with baby. Also made it harder with COVID rules as I could only have my husband visit me when he could. I couldn’t leave the ward and meet visitors downstairs because of my bp. My now middle child cried when he saw me and wouldn’t let me go. That was tough seeing how much it had been affecting him. FaceTime just wasn’t cutting it anymore. Being 5 he also couldn’t understand how he could be so close to his little sister but he couldn’t touch her. The first week there were tears. I’d had my first c-section and had no idea how the pain was going to be. I was frustrated with my bp which wasn’t helping it. It was just a lot to process things not being how they had been for my other 2 children.  
We couldn’t have got through all this without the support of family friends and also the hospital staff. It can be very lonely being here alone but talking to everyone helps relieve the pressure. It’s not easy going through this but we do get through it.  
Day 24 and we get to take our little girl home. Surprise to the older 2 though as didn’t want to get their hopes up. Anything can happen.

readBy.name: Plymouth University Health and Human Sciences students, 2018

author: Sal sal
title: Removal of a coil
body: I have been having issues with my self down below.. had an ultrasound at the hospital in August to which was told my coil had moved and I needed it out.. the doctors still couldn’t accommodate me until the middle of October to which I told the receptionist I was disappointed as I was in pain! So she suggested I rang the sexual health clinic in Burton! They got me in straight away and I had to have the after morning pill and I had to go back a few days later to get the coil removed. They couldn’t find this so I had to ring back my doctors to which Dr Wong arranged for me to go to the gynaecologist ward to which they finally removed it! The staff at the clinic were brilliant and pushed for me to get sorted so they are a credit to the NHS other than my Gp surgery to which I am most disappointed with not being as helpful until pushed by the clinic to sort me out.

author: giraffeqt83
title: Implant
body: I went in to get my first implant fitted. The woman was so kind and explained everything so well to me, made sure i had all the information and made me feel comfortable as-well which is one of the main things.

author: Mixed up but mindful
title: Sheffield mental health team and out of hours mental health team
body:
Once again I've been let down by the mental health team. I phoned up the duty team weeks ago September in a very distressed state asking to speak to a duty worker. The receptionist took my details and said they would see if anyone was free to talk to me now, they said that no one was available at the moment but someone will ring me back. It's now weeks later and no one has called me back. I feel absolutely abandoned by them. I have self harmed and are having suicidal thoughts. I phoned the out of hours mental health team to ask for help but the person who I was taking too wasn't very helpful and they made me feel even worse because I felt like I wasn't being took seriously. When I was talking I could hear the staff in the room on other calls, also I could hear some staff laughing and been loud what made me feel anxious. It made me feel like I'm being laughed at once I came off the phone. I was told that I would receive a call from the s.p.a team the next day but that didn't happen either.  
I'm trying my hardest to help myself with doing my coping strategies to try and keep safe but I know it's only a matter of time with how low I am feeling that something serious will happen to me. I really don't feel like I've got the strength to carry on and I'm really struggling with everything what's happening to me.  
Please mental health team you have to start helping people.

readBy.name: Sheffield Health and Social Care NHS Foundation Trust

author: Keeen88
title: The bed situation in A&E and AMU
body:
I came into hospital 2 weeks ago via A&E through recommendation from my GP who had found antibiotic resistance in my sputum samples. After my GP spoke to microbiology it was decided that I should attend A&E to be entered into the system. Communication between my GP and I was first class and I felt listened to and involved in decisions surrounding my care which meant that I felt much happier to attend the emergency department.  
When I arrived at A&E I was triaged quite quickly. The medical and nursing team knew what they needed to do to treat me but there were no beds on any ward for me in access. I was put on a trolley and into a side room where staff still did their best to communicate with me and treat me as best they could but I didn't feel this location or trolley was suitable to meet my needs. As a disabled person, I need use of an electric wheel chair to get around, after being put onto the trolley I needed to wait 24 hours before a bed was going to become available. Although I addressed this to the staff and they were so apologetic, they couldn't do anything more for me. In my opinion the emergency department is under resourced in every element and even through I was being treated I felt so uncomfortable and a loss of dignity. I know none of this was a fault of any of the staff are they were all doing an outstanding job and I cannot fault any element of their care, its just a lacking in facilities which is feel is becoming the 'norm' within the NHS.  
Eventually after 24 hours in the trolley I was moved to AMU. During the long 24 hour wait, as no beds were available on any wards, I almost felt guilty to be holding a bed in A&E when so many other patients in the waiting room didn't even have a chance to be seen. This being on my conscience really didn't help during the wait.  
In the AMU the staff have been brilliant, all my questions so far have been answered and I feel much more comfortable in my surroundings. I am so much happier with my ward space and know that I am becoming more clinically well everyday. I really enjoy the time I get to spend with the medical team during their rounds as I feel all my questions are answered and I am kept up to date with regards my care.  
Overall the only improvements I could suggest would be the bed situation in A&E, something seriously has to be done! None of the staff I encountered can be faulted and I am grateful for their care, skills and professionalism.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: grushk49
title: Rheumatology appointment 14/9/2021.
body:
This was my first visit to Hinchingbrooke rheumatology clinic. I was first greeted by a very pleasant nurse. She made me feel totally at ease. I was then seen by Dr Lillicrap. He was very pleasant, and explained all that he was telling me. I was then sent for blood tests, again a very pleasant lady took my bloods. Finally, I was sent for an X-ray. The radiographer was on her own. She seemed to be having to do numerous jobs as well as take my X-ray. She was very professional, but I felt very sorry for her under such strain.  
All in all, a very pleasant experience for my first visit to Dr Lillicraps clinic.  
Many thanks to all staff in departments.

readBy.name: North West Anglia NHS Foundation Trust

author: Violet Beauregarde
title: Getting an implant
body: I had a great experience at the Cowdenbeath Clinic. The staff were so lovely and really put me at ease. But the room was so hot and as someone with anxiety it can really make it a lot worse. Fans are needed.

title: Great practice
body: Currently on holiday in the Isle of Wight. Realised we had picked up empty box of medication for my husband. Rang surgery yesterday morning. Arranged electronic sending of prescription to local chemist and collected in fullmid afternoon yesterday. Very many thanks for your excellent prompt response.

title: ★★★★★ out of 5
body: I received the Flu vaccination on 12th Sunday September at the Speedwell Practice. Upon my arrival, I was greeted by the very polite and friendly lady who lead me to the main reception room for this occasion. From there, I was immediately sent right away without any delay to the treatment room where the practice nurse was waiting for me and I had the vaccination stratemawy. Everything were very professional and efficient. I was extremely satisfied with the service I received.

title: Brilliant A & E department
body: I was taken to Yeovil A & E from home yesterday via ambulance. Firstly the ambulance team and paramedic were excellent. Arrived within 15 minutes and were truly kind, and caring. Was then taken to A & E where I was seen promptly, advised what was going to happen and was smooth and QUICK. Whilst it may perhaps not been a very busy time ( I didn't know) the service was second to none. I can't praise those that I saw highly enough. The whole process from chest x ray, bloods etc was done quickly efficiently and  was only 4 hours from time in hospital to being released (thankfully). This was my first experience of Yeovil hospital having moved to Somerset fairly recently and honestly the difference between East Surrey & Croydon University hospital is so, so much better. Thank you to all of you in A & E, I just feel a little guilty I may have wasted your time, but know I am in good hands in Yeovil

readBy.name: Yeovil District Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

title: Excellent practice overall
body:
This GP practice is excellent and I have no complaints, as such.
But gaining information on how to go about assessments ( ie; Possible hip replacement surgery) I've had differing advice from the practice, dependent on who you talk to .
For example, since bilateral  hip x-rays 21 st June. were performed; Firstly informed I have to access an MSK website, fill in forms, etc; prior to GP referral. 
2 nd information given is that I can get an assessment from an in-house physiotherapist, who can then refer me to a waiting list, if required !!
So this physio call has been arranged. But it's taken 2 months so far. Very distressing when you're in the older age bracket !
Also, it would be appreciated if reminders could be sent re appointments, please. Hard to remember various appointment calls, especially with poor eyesight and memory.
Thankyou for your consideration on these matters
Regards
Anna Marieke Hemmings

title: Fantastic experience
body: Went in for a hip replacement, spent one night in a super clean room, splendid staff and food fit for a king. Thank you so much one and all

title: Professional and friendly in every department
body: I was rushed in with sepsis in great pain, I was seen immediately in A&E - I was like a racing car in a pit stop. They got me right and safe and sent me to AAU who kept a close eye on me and started all sorts of treatments before sending me to ward 6 where I treated extremely well. The discharge lounge was efficient and helpful, and a really good idea for freeing up ward staff time. Staff at every stage introduced themselves and explained what they were doing. They were friendly and professional and skilled. Can't fault it.

title: Rude and lacking empathy
body:
I’m a newly registered patient. I am pregnant. I used their app to request a referral to an osteopath. I was assured that this would be done the same week. This was 6 weeks ago and I’ve not received a referral and no one has been in touch. Luckily, my health insurance was happy to proceed without the referral in the end. Others may not be so lucky. 
I have a high risk pregnancy. I needed an urgent appointment for medication. The receptionist not only did not ask questions to see what the issue was and how they could help, they were rude and unhelpful and completely lacked empathy. Would not try to find a way to accommodate or find help for me. Apparently “this surgery is not an emergency service”. And I had to try again through the app the following morning. In the end, I called my old surgery who are absolutely amazing. First of all I was asked how I could be helped - an already warmer and friendlier approach. This receptionist’s response once I explained was “how soon can you get here”. A huge difference. Seems Queens Rd Surgery really needs to hire receptionists that exercise more empathy and ability to listen and actually want to try and help. I’m also shocked there don’t seem to be appointments available for emergencies? What if I was calling about a sick baby? I was told to go to A&E for emergencies or call 111. Thought the GP was supposed to provide some relief to the hospital and A&E system. 

I would not recommend using this surgery. I’d rather travel further back to my old surgery in my old neighbourhood than use it.

title: Poor communication
body: I hand-delivered an important letter to a GP by handing it in to a receptionist in person. 10 days later there is no record of its receipt and it wasn't scanned onto the system. VERY disappointing and delaying an application for Attendance Allowance. Communication at the Practice is poor.

title: Refuse to respond to GP recommended self-referral
body: I've now repeatedly logged a self-referral on their website as recommended by my GP then called after ten days then tweeted at them after three weeks. They simply ignore self-referrals and I'm now back to my GP this week to say - I never got through. Is there no quality control here?

title: Caring & Supportive
body: The whole team at the practice have been very helpful & supportive to my mother during recent periods of illness.  Thank you.

title: Sadly would definitely not recommend
body: Twice referral letters for my 16 old daughter promised and not sent!  She continues to suffer.  Apparently the onus is on me to phone in (which is no easy task as always 25+ in the queue to get through) to check if it has been sent. 2019 it wasn’t. She suffered through lockdown and we thought we were still waiting. Finally got another appointment in August 21 where I was informed no referral was ever sent for some reason and then told would be sent phone up finally 6 weeks later to find out has not been sent again! Have no words just a suffer 16 year old in pain and discomfort! Would not recommend. Our old surgery in Harrow, where we were for 20 years was smaller but efficient, caring and always followed up as needed. I’ve never experienced such service from a GP surgery. Getting an appointment has always been difficult too even pre pandemic.  Messages on phone lines say to book appointments online - well tried that too on a couple of occasions and get error 404 messages every time so have no choice but to wait in the queue on the phone which is never less than 45 minutes in my experience.  Again a problem we never had with previous GP surgeries phones always answered within 10 mins and online booking was easy too.  I just wonder if my elderly mother had to do this to get an appointment she would not be able to.  Luckily she is at another GP surgery and on the whole good service too.

title: Grateful thanks
body:
Thank you to the surgical staff and Ward 8A for the care I received when I had my hip replacement surgery earlier this month. 
Cannot praise all staff enough.

title: Useless service, awful staff
body: Awful, aggressive staff members especially at the reception and including the management. This practice constantly treat patients badly with no smile or service. Their computers have been down and no one had the decency to even call me to let me know that my appointment had been cancelled. I had to go down in person to find out that my appointment had been cancelled due to the computers being down. I was faced with a rude receptionist who couldn’t even be bothered to apologise. The worst practice around.

title: Fantastic service
body: I have needed to call up  twice in the last few weeks for different issues.  On both days I had to call a few times after 8am as phone lines were busy, not suprisjngly it was a Momday and once I got through by 8.30 was triaged efficiently by the reception staff and received call backs that day from physio and a doctor which was superb and suprised me in these hectic days for GPs. Thank you

title: Very organised at booking and giving flu…
body: Last Saturday my husband and I had flu vaccinations booked for 08.16 with two different medical staff. We arrived on time , directed to the appropriate room, had the vaccination and back in the car park at 08.23. At no time was I near anybody else the floor markings kept us apart and the clinic ran like clockwork. Thank you to all staff who worked last Saturday.

title: Extreme lengths to help
body: Due to a procedure I'm having in hospital I have to have c covid test three days before. The covid test at louth county is taken outside while you are sat in the car. The nurse came out to me. It was pouring with heavy rain. There was no gazebo for her to stand under, no umbrella and there she stood at my window taking my swab while I sat in the dry and being so polite at the same time. That is dedication. Just a big thank you to her as without her doing this I would not be able to have the procedure at hospital.

title: Great doctor, happy patient
body:
Having gone through emergency surgery last year during the Covid epidemic, a scary experience, the level of support and understanding from my GP doctor has been first class. He listened to my concerns, suggested options and has supported my decisions. His knowledge has transformed my life in a relatively short period of time. I can't thank you enough. 
Even though the practice is always rammed, you can always book an appointment by ringing in at 8am or using the patient access app, which is my preferred way. Great service.

title: Night staff on ward 3
body: My mum had to have a blood transfusion and because of the language barrier I was allowed to stay with her. The night time staff on ward 3 were brilliant. Although they were very busy, they took their time with my mum, explaining every single thing. The doctor was very understanding and answered all my questions. We could not have been treated any better

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2022)

title: Great service great hospital
body:
My dad was rushed in to A+E due to breathlessness. They have been so accommodating and kind to him while trying to find the problem. 

It has now been shown that he needs a pacemaker and will thus be going for surgery soon. 

Feel so grateful to have the NHS and so lucky to have Kings Mill hospital on our doorstep. Thank you

title: great Practice
body: Excellent staff and a simple procedure to remove my cataract - all covid secure and a smooth process

title: SO bad on getting initial contact!
body: Having spent four days - at various times  - ringing the number and getting engaged, engaged, engaged or once "no calls taken between....." I eventually got through to an answering machine. Here I waited for fifteen minutes to eventually speak to, I believe, a human to be told they are not taking bookings for the flu injection, ring back Friday! Absolutely so inefficient. Not even being able to make an appointment ahead to avoid this poor system.

title: good service
body:
my husband and I went for our 3 yearly review what great service

we both needed aids me for one ear hubby for both 
the assistant was excellence so patience and explained clearly what we needed and about the aids so pleased we went and will have further reviews when nec. Would not  anywhere else felt very confident with there service

title: EXCELLANT DEPARTMENT
body: From the moment you arrive at Reception to when you leave, one is treated in an efficient courteous and  kind manner.The staff take the time to answer any questions you may have and put one  at ease, especialy the hand holding Nurses. Thank you

title: Never any appointments
body: Called a few times to request a sicknote due to long covid. Initially had been advised to self cert for 7days after my covid isolation. Called the surgery at 8am (as my self cert period had come to an end) for an  appointment due to lines being i was disconnected. Finally got through to the que at 8:20, spoke to the receptionist at 8:45 to be told all appointments are gone and to call back the next morning. Explained that my employer requires a sicknote to which she replied with ‘turn up outside the surgery at 8am in the morning and they will TRY to book you in’ I do feel bad for the receptionists as they get the brunt of the patients fury. Its not fair for them. The surgery need to sort this appointment booking system it does not work. My employer had the right to not pay me if I do not supply them with a sicknote.

title: Great Reception Team
body: Had an appointment today and the receptionist was very helpful. Worthy of praise. Helped me enormously

title: Great service
body:
Yesterday morning I requested a prescription for omeprazole via your online enquiry service. I am 28 weeks pregnant and have been suffering increasingly over the last week or so despite using over the counter remedies.
Within an hour I had a reply and shortly after that I collected my prescription from the chemist.
I'm very grateful for the efficiency of the service and for not needing to make a physical appointment to see a GP or nurse. Thank you

title: Good care
body:
Me and my family have been registered here for a while and i can say that so far I have had no issues with booking an appointment.The staff are lovely,helpful and very very friendly.
On one occasion I called in the morning and unfortunately there were no available appointments,however the receptionist on the phone was very helpful indeed and managed to help me without needing an appointment .
i just wanted to leave a review here and on google because i feel like this surgery needs to be appreciated more.

title: Great service
body: From the start to finish of my visits to this hospital the staff were professional, helpful and caring. I have nothing negative to say and would be happy to be treated at this hospital again. Good level of cleanliness and covid safety. Nice clean rooms and friendly all round.

title: lovely practice
body:
The GP's that my family have seen have all be very thorough.The communication is great!!The receptionist we have spoken to are lovely.

I have put my full review on google!

title: Great practice
body: Went for flu jab, very efficient, in & out in 2 minutes. It was the same for the covid jabs. Performing well in difficult times.

title: Very friendly and helpful
body: Such friendly and helpful staff all over the hospital. I have attended a few times over the summer for outpatient appts, mainly with my children. The hospital is a bit of a maze but everytime I stopped to check signs or looked a little lost, the first member of staff passing me by has always stopped to help.one even rang the department I was heading for! I also missed an appt due to me getting the wrong date and turned up a day late. One member of staff was so kind and squeezed us in so I didn't have to make another appt. Such kindness, helpfulness and friendliness goes a long way.

title: Excellent service
body:
I had to visit the Breast Surgery unit on 13/09 and was  
Very impressed by all the staff. They all were very helpful to an elderly lady with an almost immobile arm helping me get dressed and being very gentle moving arm to the best position for tests. My hospital driver was sent elsewhere and whilst waiting for another even offered me tea and biscuits and ringing to chase new driver for me. Thank you so much. The dignity showed me well exceeded any other hospital outside the area.please tell the nurse in dark blue uniform that I forgot to take Tony Teddy to bed with me

title: Understanding GP's surgery  working in difficult…
body:
It can be difficult to get through at times if you need to ring first thing, however the surgery have worked with me over time to help make adjustments to help accessing healthcare caused by my disability, which is also the main reason why I have to attend. Telephone appointments have been made available for me when this was not a standard practice, double appointments booked when I've required extra time, and with a little explanation the reception staff have always tried to help.

Everyone is under a great deal of  stress during the current pandemic situation but the surgery, and one GP in particular (who I can't name) have been incredibly  helpful during a mental health crisis I had this year when I nearly died.

title: Fantastically fast response
body: I feel extremely lucky to have such an active and proactive medical practice so close to hand.  In particular, the provision to be able to see a doctor on the first day of presentation of symptoms if you really need to. This marvellous facility for early intervention saves patient anxiety, eradicates waiting lists, helps reduce worsening of illness and, I'm sure, saves the NHS money too.  The addition of fabulous skilled nurses and an exceptional pharmacy - as well as other things I probably don't even know about - makes life a lot easier in the face of health issues. There is kindness and compassion along with pills and poultices! Thank you.

title: Flu jab
body:
This experience is wonderful and efficient, even though I don't like needles. I was met by caring, smiling people at every turn, literally.
Even the jab was not as bad as I expected. Thank you so much.

title: Telephone enquiries impossible
body: called general number ....waited for 15 minutes before being put through to eye dept....further wait for another 20 mins or so and was then cut off..   called an hour or so later....held for 28 minutes   number 10 on waiting list...gradually reduced to number 1 over another 20 minutes ...no response save for music and then cut off.........I have always found this so and not just covid effect.         Your telephone reception is completely hopeless and it really is about time you addressed this.

readBy.name: Royal United Hospital Bath NHS Trust

title: Heart Attack emergency op and post-op treatment
body:
I started getting severe chest pains, breathlessness and sweating so called 999. The ambulance crew decided to take me to Barts Cardiac Centre as they would be equipped to treat any likely problems there and then. From the ambulance I was trolleyed straight into their operating room and immediately given an angiogram and the a stent was implanted to open a blocked coronary artery. That took about 30 minutes I reckon though I was sedated throughout. I felt immediately much better. On the ward I was given a battery of tests which covered not only the immediate heart problem but other problems. After 48 hours I was discharged with a carrier bag of new meds and ongoing monitoring.
I cannot speak too highly of the care I received both the clinical and post op care were amazing. I especially appreciated the cheerful atmosphere of the place. Everyone seemed purposeful and   good humoured. 
Any criticisms? the hospital food was ...uninspiring to put it politely. otherwise - excellent treatment - thank you, Barts!

title: Fantastic service
body: Saw my doctor Friday afternoon with a suspected TIA and within 24 hours I'd had ECG, MRI scan, an ultrasound on my neck and seen a consultant. What more could you ask for. All staff extremely kind and efficient, making me feel relaxed although it was a very worrying time.

readBy.name: Mid Essex Hospital Services NHS Trust

title: Awful and useless service
body:
If you need mental health support such as therapy , do not go through Healthy Minds, they are an appauling service.

I was left to languish on a 3 year waiting list, I rung HM-Worcestershire many times over the last 24 months to check my status on their waiting list, only to be met with confused staff members who had no clue  about what they were doing, eventually I got through to their manager of the Malvern office he told me that.. It turned out  my inital records had got "lost in the system"... after this massive mess up . I had to wait another year before being told I had to take a webinar on youtube before even being offered any sort of support.

I suffer from Post Traumatic Stress  , Anxiety and Depression. I have been holding on by a thread, waiting for the promise of proper therapy . 

After completing the webinar which was 20+ hours long, I then got an email saying I would have wait to get a review of my mental health. 

I was telephoned 2 weeks ago to book in for this review, I selected a date suitable yet the clinican cancelled on me twice so we arranged. 

I had a phone call today from HM-Worcestershire , she started by saying she could NOT offer me 1-1 counselling albeit HM Worcestershire's website says it is avaliable. 

I explained I have suffered delibating trauma and all that could be offered was a course explaining trauma and it would not be a place that I could offset my trauma, this course would also be within a group setting. 

I feel completely let down by their service , I explained to her over and over that the course would not be suitable and I had been told it would be 1-1 by many members of the HM- team .

I have been left with no choice, I declined the course and immediately went back to their website to see what they offered , as the woman on the phone had said they had NOT been doing 1-1 therapy for quite some time. 

The slogan on their website says in bold "LETS PREVENT SUICIDE" I can tell you that through my experience this is not what they will provide, they can't offer help to vulnerable people in crisis  The website does in fact say they offer 1-1 counselling but it is not the case. 

I am deeply angered and disappointed as I will have to find my own support which I wish I had known 3 years ago .

Please avoid this service like the plague, your only option is private counselling but your GP and HM wont say that to you, they will string you along for years jumping through their hoops. 

Disgusting service , your letting hundreds and hundreds of people down .

title: Worst experience of my life
body: For this surgery the patients are just numbers, the Gp is not interested in listening to the patient or take seriously the concerns expressed. The reception is even worst is been 3 days I keep ringing for complications of my wife being pregnant they can't be bothered to replay or give an appointment the 111 keep sending as back to the GP again so we are in a endless cycle. They keep saying ring at 8.30 am or 4 pm to book the appointment we been doing it day after day but the cut off the call

title: Abdominal scan
body: Whole experience was wonderful , Doctor and Nurse very professional very friendly they made me feel very comfortable .

title: Lovely staff on the Silver heart unit
body: Everything about my most recent experience was positive. The staff on the Silver heart unit were absolutely lovely from start to finish.  The unit seemed extremely well run, efficient, organised and very clean. I felt in very hands.  The procedure was explained very well and again was done Safely and efficiently with no problems. The pre-op a few days earlier was also a positive experience. The gentleman was thorough and explained everything with such a nice manner. I’ve got a lot going on with my health and it really does make a difference when you experience such wonderful care. Thank you.

title: Absolutely amazing staff and care
body: I attended accident and emergency which was extremely busy. I was kept up to date every step of the way and the care and kindness I received was amazing. I can't thank everyone enough for looking after me. I would like to say a special thanks to one member of staff. However I note your conditions state that we should not name individuals. There was a lot of people attending the department but it was very smoothly run and I feel totally confident in recommending you to other people.

title: Doing Great
body: I always find the staff at the clinic so happy to help even with the current staffing struggles. I have been a member of the practice for over a year now they are brilliant
